headline.main: HEALTH: Birth Control; For Those Concerned With Pill's Risk, a Look at the Choices

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: With new studies hinting that birth control pills may be linked to an increased risk of breast cancer, many women and doctors are taking a closer look than ever at contraceptive choices, weighing the risks and benefits of the various methods.
docs.snippet: LEAD: With new studies hinting that birth control pills may be linked to an increased risk of breast cancer, many women and doctors are taking a closer look than ever at contraceptive choices, weighing the risks and benefits of the various methods.

headline.main: Koop's Stand on Abortion's Effect Surprises Friends and Foes Alike

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Once again Dr. C. Everett Koop, Surgeon General of the United States, has confounded the White House and Congress, liberals and conservatives. This time he told President Reagan in a letter Monday that, after extensive study, he could not conclude one way or another that abortions were harmful to women.

headline.main: U.S. Report Raises Estimate of Smoking Toll

byline.original: By RICHARD L. BERKE, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Twenty-five years after the Surgeon General of the United States jolted the nation with the first official warning of the health perils of cigarettes, a Federal report has concluded that smoking has caused more death and disease than previously believed.
